div.head: John Cage Will
div.p:
In the name of God Amen. I John Cage of Charles County in the
province of Maryland planter though sick and weak in body yet sound
and perfect in memory bequeath my soule to God that gave me it & my
body to the earth and for my temporal Estate what God hath been pleased
to endow me with all I desire it may be dispersed as followeth

my will and desire is that my dear and well beloved wife Susannah
Cage should be my sole Executor of all my personal Estate and after my
Just and lawfull Debts be paud to disperse of it as she shall think fit
secondly

Secondly I give and bequeath unto my Executor before named my now Dwelling
plantation situated & lying upon the of Nicheocomics River by estimation
Layd out for three hundred acres more or less for & to profit
and enjoy during her natural life and after her decrease unto my beloved
son John Cage unto him and his heirs forever but if the said John Cage shall
die without heirs Lawfully begotten by him or before he come to the age of one
& twenty years then my will is that the aforementioned land goe unto my
younger son Willaim Cage him and his heirs forever.

Thirdly I give unto my Daughter Margery Rowland one young bay horse & marked
on the rear buttock with G two years old or thereabouts

Fourthly I give and bequeath unto my Daughter Voider two chickens each of them one two
year old heffer marked with my one proper mark and to be delivered this spring
In oewing with all their increase.

Fifthly my will and desire is that the Remand of my personal Estate remaine in the
hands and of my Executor first named untill my Daughter Ann
Comes to the ahe of sixteen or day of marriage and then an Equal division be
made of all my personal Estate amongst my sonn John and William
aforementioned and my Daughter Ann and the child my wife nowe goeth
going afrom one to another and the longeth liver profets all and these
presens make void & all former wills by me made &
& seal this 12th day of February anno Domino 1676.

In the presents of us...
John Faming-Henry Reynolds
John X Cage

On the nack of the foregoing was Endorsed the following probit (to will)
July 9th 1677. Then was the within written will probated in commmon form
oaths of John Faming and Henry Reynolds witness to the same.
4 1/4 sides
Benjamin Rozer
